alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 26 at 2:39PM MST until July 26 at 3:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR LOCATIONS EAST OF BAGDAD IN YAVAPAI COUNTY... At 237 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rain has ended across the warned area. However, flash flooding is still expected as water drains. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Yavapai County This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Kirkland Creek, Santa Maria River, Sycamore Creek, Little Sycamore Wash, Cottonwood Canyon, Boulder Creek, Loco Creek, Smith Canyon and Big Shipp Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
